item.description:
Yup, that's right! Our infamous murder mystery parties are back!

We'll try to fit in as many people as we can as the event gets closer, so please feel free to join the waiting list. Also, we need a few more guys to fill up a couple more of the roles. Please help us out, we have a great time!

 

Prince Charming cordially invites you to

the royal ball.

 

************************************************************************

If you RSVP YES, you MUST attend and arrive ON TIME. Everyone is required to play their part, or the game won't work. That means if you cancel last minute, you throw off the game for EVERYONE else. If you're unsure if you'll be able to make attend or not, do NOT RSVP yes.

************************************************************************

How does all of this work?

1. Sign up for a character by posting a comment at the bottom of this page.

2. Dress up as that character. (Yes, you MUST dress up).

Example of a place you can find costumes: http://www.buycostumes.com/

3. Bring a salad, drink, appetizer, or dessert to share with the group. The main course will be provided.

4. Show up!

The rest is easy. When you arrive, you will get a piece of paper with all the information you need, including the lines you have to say throughout the course of the party.

 

Once Upon a Murder

 

1. PRINCE CHARMING • Prince. The leader of the kingdom and heartthrob to many, this dashing young man will have numerous decisions to make all of which will affect the outcome of the night. Dashing and debonair, this guest will be able to please everyone. -Tyler

2. FELICITY • Cinderella’s Fairy Godmother. Still doting over the disappearance of her goddaughter, Felicity continues to hope that Cinderella will reappear and everyone will live happily ever after. Magical and mystical, this guest will be motherly and overprotective. - Stacy - Iced Tea

3. GRISELDA • Cinderella’s Stepsister. After years of animosity, Griselda has earned Cinderella’s trust and her place in castle. Now that Cinderella is gone, will Griselda be next to disappear mysteriously? True to those she loves, this guest needs to be able to keep secrets. -Lauren - fruit & cheese plate

4. RAPUNZEL • Princess. Desperate to get out of her tower, this trapped temptress may have  more than one offer on the table… the question is which one will she pick? Often off in her own world, this guest should be superficial and also conniving. - Kelly - dessert

5. SNOW • Snow White. With hopes of moving out of the forest, this princess hopes to soon be known not as the daughter of a queen that is evil, but as the wife of prince that is charming. Confident, but insecure about her own abilities to suceed. Will need to be able to be vindictive. - Amber - Dessert

6. HERB • Dwarf. Like a brother to Snow, Snow’s dependence on Herb is endearing to some and annoying to others. - Is anyone interested in playing Herb?

7. NOSY • Dwarf (Gender Neutral). Ambitious and inquisitive, this dwarf can’t keep their nose out of anyone’s business. Be hopeful you are not the murderer, because Nosy will be out to expose you! This guest must be comfortable speaking to the group and investigating everyone personally. - Heather

8. ALADDIN • Prince. Royalty by marriage, Aladdin continues to use his power to grow his palace collection of possessions. At what point will his princess say enough is enough? This guest will need to behave superficially and care very much about his appearance. - Stu - Salad and dressings

9. JASMOOR • Princess. Feeling left out by all of the excitement around the search for a new princess, Jasmine is left to herself and her palace. Jasmoor is pouty and demanding. - Carol - deviled eggs

10. JINN • Genie (Gender neutral). Put in this world to grant Aladdin’s wishes, Jinn can’t solve Aladdin’s problems single-handedly, but they will try…A subservient role, the guest who plays Jinn should be helpful, accomodating, and a bit of a matchmaker. - Meg - Appetizer

11. BELLE • Beast’s wife. Suspicious of her husband’s actions, Belle is not the only one who is questioning what Beast is doing in the woods. Kind and gentle, the guest who plays this role should also be capable of holding a grudge. - Rebecca - Main Dish

12. BEAST • Belle’s husband. Once feared for his appearance, Beast has taken on a new identity as prince. While his physique may have changed, that doesn’t mean his temperament has. A larger person, the guest who plays Beast will be kind, generous, and on the quiet side. - Luke - Main Dish

13. HANSEL • Orphan. In love with a princess, the only way Hansel can gain her affection is to prove he will adequately provide for her. Eager, creative, and ambitious to win the love of Rapunzel. - Mike

14. GRETEL • Orphan. Left behind as a child, Gretel will not allow for her beau to do the same. The guest who plays this character needs to be a little self-centered and demanding. Even though she is not a princess, she demands the best! - Deb M - appetizer (and maybe some gumdrops :) )

15. RED • Little Red Riding Hood. This is one girl who is certainly not distracted or lost. Red will use her will and wit to make sure she and her grandmother are taken care of. Ambitious and decisive, Red is outgoing, focused, and after the prince's heart. - Jocelyn - Chips

16. GRAM • Red’s Grandmother. Aging and helpless, this grandmother once fought off a wolf with the help of the woodcutter - will history be able to repeat itself? This character should be someone who is motherly and protective, as well as unafraid to negotiate or strike a deal. - Linda - Utensils & Napkins

17. AXE • Woodcutter. Protector of Gram and Red, Axe refuses to seek his own happiness until he insures Gram and Red are provided for. Strong and powerful. This father-figure needs to be very masculine and also endearing. - Todd

18. TEETH • Big, Bad Wolf. After earlier wishing to devour Red, now he hopes to marry her. Red has other plans for her future, but it is unclear what her beholders intend. Intensely evil down to the bone, the character that plays the wolf is just looking out for his own best interests. J - creamy, chocolately dessert

19. RUMPELSTILTZKIN • Imp. Known for trickery, scheming and deception, Rumpelstiltzkin’s tactics may be just what this kingdom needs to find out who really is behind Cinderella’s disappearance… A swindler and very greedy. The person who plays this guest should be very competitive an out to make a profit. - Robert - bread

20. HAMLET • Little Pig (Gender Neutral). This seasoned realtor knows a thing or two about building and selling houses. A smooth-talker and slick salesperson. A guest with knowledge of the real estate world would be ideal for this role. - Jeff

21. ARIEL • The Mermaid (OBSERVER). Recognized for her long red hair and amazing singing voice, Ariel was out singing the night of the murder and may have heard just the right tune. - Wendy - Appetizer

22. ROSE • Snow White's Sister (OBSERVER). Although she's less well known, Rose is quite rambunctious and enjoys playing games outside in the woods during the summer. - Vickie - Cookies

23. FROG • Prince or Princess (OBSERVER - Gender neutral). Just because your a frog, doesn't mean you're not out for the one who put you in the pond. -Crystal - veggie plate

24. MINERVA  • Witch (OBSERVER - Gender neutral). No fairy tale murder mystery is complete without a witch! Beware, you never know what spells may be enchanting our guests. - Tricia - Cheese & Crackers

25. TINKERBELL •  Fairy. Tinkerbell enjoys adding a little bit confusion to the party. She's still on the hunt for true love, and since it didn't work out with Peter Pan, she's hoping she can catch Prince Charming. Tinkerbell is sneaky and tries to create conflict between the other princesses so she can win Prince Charming's heart. - Lori - Olives & Salad

26. FOOL • Court Jester (OBSERVER - Gender neutral). Every castle needs a fool. But don't let the good looks and jester outfit fool you. The fool is one wily character who knows everything going on behind castle walls. - Susan - Dessert

27. DRAGON • Dragon (OBSERVER - Gender neutral). What fairy tale is complete without a little bit of fire breathing? - Tom - Soda & Beer

28. JONATHAN - Prince - What fun is a ball if there's only one prince? - Derek - See Lori
item.name: Murder Mystery Party - Once Upon a Murder
